intro: Chaetacanthus burchellii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds with silky appendages. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
